alert.note: Alert for Logan; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 8:44PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Nebraska and west central Nebraska, including the following counties, in north central Nebraska, Thomas. In west central Nebraska, Logan. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Thomas and Northeastern Logan Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
